meanings.sent1: She reassorted the candies into separate jars.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reassorted the students into new groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels reassorted the acorns in a playful game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces reassorted themselves into a new picture.
meanings.sent5: The books on the shelf reassorted into a colorful display.

meanings.definition: To mix or combine in a different way
meanings.sent1: He reassorted the colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent2: The chef reassorted the ingredients to make a special dish.
meanings.sent3: The children reassorted the building blocks into a wacky tower.
meanings.sent4: The music notes reassorted into a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The flowers reassorted in the garden, creating a lovely blend of colors.

meanings.definition: To reorganize or rearrange in a new pattern
meanings.sent1: They reassorted the furniture to give the room a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The team reassorted their strategies to improve their performance.
meanings.sent3: The clouds reassorted in the sky, forming funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The stars reassorted in the night sky, twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The leaves reassorted on the tree, creating a beautiful canopy.
